name: SNAC
body: ### Sensor Networks for Autonomous Cars SNAC is a system designed for use in the next generation of autonomous cars. Currently, it is capable of the following: * Counting the number of cars in opposing traffic * Speed estimation of cars in opposing traffic Utilizing these pieces of information, it is capable of traffic estimation, primarily utilizing monocular vision. When combined with an ad hoc car-to-car communication network, in theory, it will be able to generate crowdsourced traffic information. Some features to be implemented in the future: * Mapping capability to geographically store data * Robust detection of various traffic signs (stop signs, yield signs, speed limit signs, etc.) * Detection of obstacles (cars stopped on the road, accidents, major potholes, etc.) ### The system "Picture of in car assembly" Sensors: * 1 x [Omnivision OV10635 USB 3.0 Camera](https://www.leopardimaging.com/LI-USB30-OV10635.html) * 1 x [Garmin GPS18-5Hz](https://buy.garmin.com/en-US/US/oem/sensors-and-boards/gps-18x-oem/prod27594.html) ### Traffic Flow Greeeeeeeeen shield ### Authors and Contributors Me & Pavan Gorki no no ### Support or Contact Google is yo friend
